name: Scope of incontestable clauses
text: §431:10D-109  Scope of incontestable clauses.  A clause in any policy of life insurance providing that such policy shall be incontestable after a specified period shall preclude only a contest of the validity of the policy, and shall not preclude the assertion at any time of defenses based upon provisions in the policy which exclude or restrict coverage, whether or not the restrictions or exclusions are excepted in the clause. [L 1987, c 347, pt of §2]
